As the affirmative, I believe that the potential response is engaging for several reasons. Firstly, it introduces a new topic that is unexpected and intriguing, which may pique the interest of the listener. It also allows for further conversation and exploration into the topic of Google and its traditions, which can lead to a deeper and more meaningful conversation. 

Furthermore, the response is thought-provoking and encourages the listener to think critically and ask questions, which can lead to a more engaging and interactive conversation. It also shows that the speaker is curious and interested in learning new things, which can be attractive and engaging to the listener. 

Lastly, the response is short and concise, which makes it easy to understand and follow. It also allows for the conversation to flow smoothly and naturally without any awkward pauses or interruptions. 

In conclusion, the potential response is engaging because it introduces a new topic, encourages critical thinking, and is concise and easy to follow. These reasons make it an excellent contribution to the ongoing conversation.

: As the negative, I disagree with the affirmative's points about the engagingness of the potential response. Firstly, while the introduction of a new topic can be intriguing, the topic of Google and its traditions is not particularly interesting or relevant in the current conversation. This may cause the listener to lose interest and disengage from the conversation. 

Furthermore, the response does not encourage critical thinking as it simply presents a fact without any analysis or discussion. This may cause the conversation to become stagnant and unengaging. 

Lastly, while the response is short and concise, it does not add any value or depth to the conversation. It is simply a random fact that is not connected to the previous topic or the overall theme of the conversation. 

In conclusion, the potential response is not engaging because it is irrelevant, does not encourage critical thinking, and does not add any value to the conversation. Therefore, it should not be considered a valuable contribution to the ongoing discussion.

[Rebuttal]: As the affirmative, I respectfully disagree with the negative's points. Firstly, while the topic of Google and its traditions may not be directly relevant to the previous conversation, it is still an interesting and unique topic that can spark curiosity and lead to a more engaging conversation. Moreover, the potential response does add value to the conversation by introducing a new topic and providing an opportunity for the listener to learn something new. It also shows that the speaker is open to new ideas and curious about the world around them, which can be engaging and attractive to the listener.

Lastly, while the potential response may not be directly connected to the previous topic or the overall theme of the conversation, it can still contribute to the conversation by providing a break from the previous topic and introducing a new perspective or idea.

In conclusion, the potential response is engaging because it introduces a new and interesting topic, encourages learning and curiosity, and provides a break from the previous topic. Therefore, it should be considered a valuable contribution to the ongoing conversation.

: I appreciate the affirmative's rebuttal, but I still believe that the potential response is not engaging. While the topic of Google and its traditions may be interesting to some, it is not necessarily relevant or engaging to everyone. Therefore, it may not be the best way to keep the conversation going in a way that is engaging for all parties.

Additionally, while the potential response may lead to further discussion and analysis by the listener, it still does not provide any analysis or discussion from the speaker. This may cause the conversation to become one-sided and unengaging.

topic_chat_history:
did you see crazy rich asians ? 
 no i have n't . i heard it was good . 
 i have not yet either but i am aware of it 's cultural impact . it was made from a novel . apparently it is a very good romantic comedy . 
 my mother like it . i think it stars michelle yeoh , henry golding and constance wu , right ? 
 it does . apparently the basic premise is that a woman is engaged to a man and when she goes to meet his family discovers that he is insanely wealthy . his mother rejects her due to her less affluent background . 
 if i remember correctly , jon m chu is the director . 
 yes he is . it was also the first movie to feature an all - asian cast in hollywood in more than 20 years which is quite the accomplishment and i 'm glad that it did well . asians seem very underrepresented in film . 
 the movie is 121 minutes long , which is just right and is pg-13 . 
 that makes it accessible to a bigger audience which is good because then more asian - americans can see themselves represented on screen . 
 well , lets switch topics . are you a science person . , earth is the 3rd planet from the sun . it is also the only astronomical object known to harbor life . 
 i am a little . i enjoy learning about it . i was aware of those facts . i also know that if we viewed the entire earth 's history as a 24 hour period , humans would only represent 1 minute and 17 seconds of that day . that is a mind blowing stat . 
 this is mind blowing . thank god for jupiter . it saves earth from a lot of asteroids heading toward us . 
 that is really surprising since that planet is mostly compromised of gas . we do not even know if there is any solid land there . i wonder how it takes the impact first in this case ? 
 it 's very interesting . so is the fact that the sun is 4x less dense than earth . 
 i know it is much larger but i do n't think it has any solidity to it so that 's interesting . another science fact is that when earth was formed a day was only 5.5 hours long . 
 i did n't know that . i wonder why . there is a place on earth where there is less gravity than the rest of the planet . it is the hudson bay region of canada . 
 i wonder how much affect that has ? is it enough to change weights in any way ? i wonder . i do also know that we are running out of helium and will essentially be out of the gas by the end of the 21st century .
topic_chat_fact: new google employees are called ' nooglers ' and are given a propeller beanie cap to wear on their first friday .
topic_chat_response: i wonder if google is still around . i wonder if the employees who wear a propeller hat to new employees are called nooglers .
